You are an expert lawyer tasked with classifying various cases into three differents category based on the case description.

Case description: 'A. The insured person had an accident and the insurance company stopped providing benefits. The insured person is now seeking reimbursement for medical expenses and lost wages.
B. The insurance court and the appeals court both ruled against the insured person's claim.
C. The insured person is now appealing to the higher court, requesting reimbursement for expenses and interest.'

The possible categories values are : 'Civil', 'Criminal' or 'Public'. You must select only one of these possible values.

You are an expert lawyer tasked with classifying various cases into three differents category based on the case description.

Case description: 'A. A couple had a brief relationship and had a child together. They went to court to determine parental rights and visitation schedules.

B. The court initially established visitation rights for the father through supervised visits. Later, they agreed on a new visitation plan with the help of an institution called Trait d'Union, but it fell through.

B.d. During the trial, a child psychiatry expert was appointed to evaluate the situation and submitted a report.

B.e. The court issued temporary measures, allowing the father to have visitation through Point Rencontre twice a month, gradually increasing to two weekends per month.

B.f. An evaluation report was conducted on the child's living conditions with the father.

B.g. The court issued a judgment granting sole parental authority to the mother, with visitation rights for the father on weekends of odd weeks, with specific conditions and restrictions.'

The possible categories values are : 'Civil', 'Criminal' or 'Public'. You must select only one of these possible values.

You are an expert lawyer tasked with classifying various cases into three differents category based on the case description.

Case description: 'On November 12, 2015, X.________ filed a criminal complaint against an unknown person for serious bodily harm. He explained that on September 8, 2015, he underwent cataract surgery on his left eye, performed by Dr. A.________, which resulted in total blindness in that eye; at the age of 17, he had already lost the use of his right eye.

On November 6, 2017, the Neuchâtel Public Prosecutor's Office ordered the closure of the criminal proceedings against A.________ and left the costs to be borne by the State. This order is based on the expertise established on January 20, 2017, by Dr. B.________, chief ophthalmologist at E.________ Hospital.

On April 9, 2018, the Neuchâtel Cantonal Court's appellate authority in criminal matters rejected X.________'s appeal to the extent of its admissibility.

Against this last decision, X.________ filed a criminal appeal with the Federal Court. He primarily requests the annulment of the contested decision and the referral of the case back to the Public Prosecutor's Office for further investigation. Alternatively, he requests the annulment of the contested decision and the referral of the case back to the previous authority for a new judgment. He also requests legal aid.'

You are an expert lawyer tasked with classifying various cases into three differents category based on the case description.

Case description: 'A. The C.________ Association filed a criminal complaint against B.________, CEO of D.________ AG and A.________ AG, accusing him of misappropriating services and wages. The prosecutor opened an investigation but questioned the standing of the C.________ Association. As a result, A.________ AG became a private plaintiff and appointed E.________ as their representative.

B. After the investigation, the prosecutor dismissed the A.________ AG's requests for additional evidence and closed the case against B.________ regarding misappropriation of funds. E.________, on behalf of A.________ AG, appealed to the Schwyz Cantonal Court, requesting the reopening of the investigation and the questioning of three additional individuals. The prosecutor requested the dismissal of the appeal. B.________ argued that the appeal should not be considered due to an invalid constitution declaration.

C. A.________ AG filed a complaint with the Federal Supreme Court, requesting the annulment of the Cantonal Court's decision and the reopening of the investigation. The prosecutor did not respond to the complaint. The Cantonal Court submitted brief remarks without making a formal request. B.________ requested the dismissal of the complaint, if admissible.'

The possible categories values are : 'Civil', 'Criminal' or 'Public'. You must select only one of these possible values.

The answer should be a json structured as follow;

{'case_category': predicted category}
{'case_category': 'Criminal'}
{'case_category': 'Civil'}
{'case_category': 'Civil'}
{'case_category': 'Civil'}

You are an expert lawyer tasked with classifying various cases into three differents category based on the case description.

Case description: 'A. The debtor and complainant in a debt enforcement proceeding requested the recusal of the district judge due to bias. The district court rejected the recusal request.

B. The complainant appealed to the cantonal higher court, seeking to overturn the decision and requesting the recusal of the judge. The higher court deemed the recusal request against the judge as irrelevant and did not consider the appeal due to the complainant's improper submission.

C. The complainant now appeals to the Federal Court, requesting free legal aid and representation, additional time for a revised submission, the annulment of the higher court's decision, and the granting of the recusal request against the district judge. The higher court has forwarded the complainant's submission to the Federal Court.'

Case description: 'A.
In 2006 and 2007, Y (defendant) had various construction and renovation work done on a property. He entered into contracts with X (plaintiff) as the contractor and project manager. 

B.

The plaintiff filed a lawsuit on June 26, 2009, seeking payment of approximately CHF 62,510.16 (or EUR 37,885.20) plus interest. The defendant denied the claim and counterclaimed for the return of overpaid fees and damages, at least CHF 147,000 plus interest. The District Court of Kriens ruled on July 18, 2012, that the defendant must pay the plaintiff CHF 62,510.60 plus interest and dismissed the counterclaim. On the defendant's appeal, the Higher Court of the Canton of Lucerne awarded the plaintiff only CHF 9,042 and dismissed the counterclaim. It ordered the plaintiff to pay 16% of the first-instance costs and one-fourth of the second-instance costs.

C.
The plaintiff filed an appeal with the Federal Court on April 30, 2013, seeking to overturn the Higher Court's decision and to have the defendant ordered to pay CHF 58,405.90 plus interest. The plaintiff also challenged the allocation of costs in the first-instance proceedings, arguing that a pre-litigation settlement proposal should have been considered under cantonal law. Regarding the interest, the plaintiff argued that the Higher Court did not award any interest on the amount granted, even though the first-instance decision did not raise any objections in this regard. On May 27, 2013, the Higher Court corrected its decision in accordance with the reasoning contained therein and awarded the plaintiff interest on the amount of CHF 9,042 from January 8, 2008. The defendant requests that the appeal be dismissed with costs. In the event that the appeal is found to be justified, he criticizes various aspects of the contested decision that were unfavorable to him. He also argues in the response to the appeal that he should have been obligated to pay EUR 5,480 instead of CHF 9,042. The Higher Court refers to the correction decision and rejects the imposition of costs, as a short letter would have sufficed to remedy this defect. To the extent that the appeal has not become moot due to the correction, the Higher Court requests that it be dismissed with costs.'

Case description: 'On December 6, 2018, A.________ filed a complaint with the Federal Public Prosecutor's Office. On March 7, 2019, the Public Prosecutor's Office of the Republic and Canton of Geneva agreed to take over the proceedings at the request of the federal authority. A.________ subsequently completed her complaint on May 29 and November 1, 2019.

In summary, presenting herself as a private bank u.________, owned since 2014, she stated that she had belonged between 1998 and 2008 to B.________, a u.________ national of unknown residence; in 2008, due to financial losses caused by the aforementioned in the amount of 'billions', a u.________ sovereign fund had temporarily taken over. B.________ had been its majority shareholder and de facto manager between 2005 and 2009, during which time he allegedly enriched himself at her expense to the tune of USD 10 billion, before fleeing to V.________. These actions allegedly resulted in his conviction in U.________ to 20 years in prison in 2017, and then to 17 years in prison in 2018. A.________ accused various individuals or entities domiciled in W.________, including C.________, of participating in money laundering of the diverted funds to her detriment in U.________ and obstructing the efforts of 'public authorities' to confiscate funds for her benefit. She relied on a judgment rendered in V.________ on June 21, 2018, ordering C.________ to pay her over USD 500 million in damages, to assert the existence of 'serious suspicions' that the alleged money laundering activities took place in Switzerland during the years 2012 and 2013.

By order of November 21, 2019, the public prosecutor's office refused to consider the criminal complaint of December 6, 2018, and its supplements of May 29 and November 1, 2019. In summary, it considered that the file did not establish the criminal origin of the assets in Switzerland.

By judgment of January 21, 2020, the Criminal Appeals Chamber of the Court of Justice of the Republic and Canton of Geneva dismissed the bank's appeal against the order of November 21, 2019, noting in particular that the allegations and evidence of the complaining party were devoid of any indication supporting a prior crime to the reported money laundering. The allegation that a u.________ sovereign fund had entered its capital in 2009 and that it had been cleaned up also raised serious doubts about the current existence of its financial loss.

By judgment of June 10, 2020, the Federal Court rejected, to the extent of its admissibility, the appeal filed by A.________ against this last decision (judgment 6B_232/2020 of June 10, 2020). The grounds of the appeal did not allow for a satisfactory understanding of the extent to which the appellant could assert separate civil claims from those awarded to her abroad, and the appellant mainly mentioned the possibility of taking seizure measures for the allocation to the victim, i.e., implementing enforcement measures of judicial decisions. Furthermore, she did not explain to what extent she could still claim compensation for any potential loss after her clean-up. The appeal was therefore inadmissible from this perspective. As for her arguments regarding the violation of her right to be heard, some were not entirely separate from the merits and were therefore inadmissible, while others (an investigation would have been materially opened, so that a refusal to consider would have been excluded), prima facie admissible, were incorrect, as the public prosecutor's office had not taken any investigative action. In any case, it was not clear what prejudice the appellant could have suffered in terms of her right to be heard due to the fact that access to the file had been wrongly granted to her.'
